definition: Rear a tiger and court disaster. (idiom); fig. if you're too lenient with sb, he will damage you later/to cherish a snake in one's bosom
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to suffer (from illness)/to contract (a disease)/misfortune/trouble/danger/worry

sentences.english: Well; I guess shewouls trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，大要想跟我玩“养虎遗患”的游戏吧。

definition: lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
large tail obstructs action (idiom); bottom heavy/fig. rendered ineffective by subordinates
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
to show the wolf into the house (idiom)/to introduce a potential source of trouble
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
see 偷雞不成蝕把米|偷鸡不成蚀把米[tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3]
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 zhao2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: short-sighted
